conclusion: To determine the ratio of the magnitudes of the accelerations of particles A and B during their acceleration phases, we need to analyze their velocity-time (v-t) graphs.
Particle A accelerates from rest to a velocity of 2v0 between 0 and t0.
Particle B accelerates from rest to a velocity of v0 between 0 and 5t0.

premise: The velocity changes from 0 to 2v0 for Particle A over a time duration of t0.
conclusion: Acceleration a_A is the slope of the velocity-time graph for A: a_A = 2v0/t0.

premise: The velocity changes from 0 to v0 for Particle B over a time duration of 5t0.
conclusion: Acceleration a_B is the slope of the velocity-time graph for B: a_B = v0/5t0.
